column3: Brother of Joseph Smith. Was removed from the Quorum due to apostasy May 4, 1839, but readmitted May 25, 1839. Was then excommunicated for apostasy on October 6, 1845. Followed James J. Strang for a time, then started his own LDS Church in Covington, Kentucky. In later years he joined the RLDS Church (now Community of Christ) and was a petitioner for RLDS Patriarchate from  April 1872 to November 13, 1893.
column4: Brother of Joseph Smith. Was removed from the Quorum due to apostasy May 4, 1839, but readmitted May 25, 1839. Was then excommunicated for apostasy on October 6, 1845. Followed James J. Strang for a time, then started his own LDS Church in Covington, Kentucky. In later years he joined the RLDS Church (now Community of Christ) and was a petitioner for RLDS Patriarchate from  April 1872 to November 13, 1893.

column3: Younger brother of Parley P. Pratt. Was excommunicated for apostasy August 20, 1842, but readmitted January 20, 1843. As a result, was given reduced seniority in June 1875. Last surviving member of the original Quorum. Under the direction of Brigham Young, he published The Seer.
